title: Watch: Kerala becomes India’s first state to end extreme poverty
description: Kerala Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan has declared the state free of extreme poverty, marking a major milestone in social welfare. The initiative, launched in 2021, focused on targeted support through housing for 4.7 lakh families, pensions for 62 lakh, and personalised micro plans for 64,000 households. Powered by public participation and coordinated government efforts, this project aims to ensure lasting social and economic upliftment across Kerala.

title: H-1B visa LCA submissions: FLAG system back online; employers can resume applications

The Department of Labor's Foreign Labor Application Gateway (FLAG) system is back online after a funding lapse caused a temporary shutdown. While processing has resumed, expect delays as the agency clears a backlog of applications.

This marks the seventh crewed flight to the station, with the astronauts set to replace the current crew and conduct experiments with the first small mammals in orbit. The mission underscores China's expanding space program and its growing competition with the United States.

Uttar Pradesh expands medical education: 950 MBBS seats; 271 PG seats added
description: Uttar Pradesh MBBS seats: Uttar Pradesh has approved the addition of 950 MBBS and 271 PG seats across government and private medical colleges for the 2025-26 academic session. Government colleges will gain 200 MBBS and 233 PG seats, while private institutions will add 750 MBBS and 38 PG seats. This expansion increases total MBBS seats to 12,800 and total PG seats to 4,297, aiming to strengthen healthcare infrastructure, enhance medical education capacity, and address doctor shortages across urban and rural areas in the state.

First Indian woman! 32-yo Pundole on the brink of history with Ferrari
description: Pune's Diana Pundole is set to make history as the first Indian woman to race a Ferrari internationally. Competing in the Ferrari Club Challenge Middle East from November 2025 to April 2026, she will drive the powerful 296 Challenge car across renowned F1 tracks in the region. This significant achievement aims to inspire more Indian women to embrace motorsport.

description: US and China have agreed to a temporary truce in their trade war, pausing new tariffs and export curbs. Key deals include China resuming significant soybean purchases, US cutting fentanyl-related tariffs, and China lifting rare-earth export restrictions. This de-escalation offers a year-long window for further negotiations.

Bopanna, who achieved remarkable milestones including becoming the oldest Grand Slam winner and World No. 1, expressed his pride in representing India. He remains committed to developing the sport through his academy and UTR Tennis Pro.

title: Watch: Hamas loots Gaza aid truck; US military drone catches it on camera
description: US Central Command released drone footage showing suspected Hamas operatives looting an aid truck in southern Gaza. The operatives attacked the driver and stole the truck and its contents, undermining international efforts to deliver vital assistance. Senator Marco Rubio condemned the act, calling Hamas an impediment to aid for Gazan civilians.

description: A workplace dispute over switching off lights tragically escalated into murder in Bengaluru. A 41-year-old manager was bludgeoned to death with a dumbbell by a colleague after a heated argument. The accused, a 24-year-old technical executive, surrendered to the police. Investigations into the shocking incident are ongoing.

Emails show discussions between Epstein and former JPMorgan executive Jes Staley about potential clients and meetings with Prince Andrew.

description: A 25-year-old woman, Supriya, was discovered deceased in her locked Bengaluru residence on Saturday. Her body was found hanging in a room on the third floor. Police have seized her mobile phone for forensic analysis. A case of unnatural death has been registered following a complaint from her family.

US ends EAD extensions, hikes H-1B fees, toughens citizenship test for Indians
description: The US has implemented three major immigration changes affecting Indian professionals and Green Card holders. Automatic EAD extensions have ended, H-1B visa fees have risen to $100,000 for new petitions, and the civics test for naturalisation has become more challenging. These changes introduce delays, higher costs, and stricter eligibility requirements, directly impacting employment, career planning, and citizenship pathways for Indians. Companies sponsoring Indian talent are also adjusting hiring practices in response to the new rules.

‘Act of God’: Builder of Andhra temple where 9 died in stampede says nobody is responsible
description: A stampede at a privately run temple in Srikakulam district, Andhra Pradesh, killed nine devotees and injured over 25 when a railing collapsed on a narrow staircase. Panic ensued in a crowd of over 20,000 gathered for Karthika Ekadashi, with poor crowd control and lack of official clearance contributing to the tragedy. Authorities are investigating the incident.

title: End of an era! Kane Williamson retires; calls for 'clarity’ ahead of T20 world cup
description: New Zealand's Kane Williamson has retired from T20 internationals to provide clarity for the team ahead of next year's T20 World Cup. The 35-year-old leaves as the second-highest T20I run-scorer for New Zealand, having guided them to the 2021 T20 World Cup final. He will now focus on Test cricket and spending more time with his family.

title: Women's World Cup: 'Superior to us in 1983!' - Kapil Dev backs India to create history
description: Legendary Kapil Dev lauded the Indian women's cricket team's exceptional performance, stating they are superior to his 1983 World Cup-winning squad. He urged fans to appreciate the team's intelligent and elevated style of play, not just the outcome of the upcoming World Cup final against South Africa. Dev believes the team is ready to create history.

title: Horses take centre stage at Pushkar fair this year with sales totalling Rs 75 lakh
description: The Pushkar annual cattle fair witnessed a significant shift this year as Marwadi and Kathiawadi horse sales overshadowed traditional bovine trade. Horses and camels are increasingly being purchased for transportation purposes in rural areas, with bulls seeing a sharp decline in sales due to modern farming equipment. The highest horse sale recorded was Rs 4.

description: An early Saturday morning explosion at Harvard Medical School's Goldenson Building has been deemed 'intentional' by authorities. A police officer observed two masked individuals fleeing the scene just before the blast. While no injuries were reported, investigators are seeking public assistance to identify the suspects captured in released photos. The FBI is also involved in the ongoing investigation.

title: Chennai Port to revive massive outer harbour project at ₹8,000 crore

He will remain in Sydney for follow-up care for the next seven to ten days, prioritising his complete well-being over an immediate return to cricket.

description: The New York Yankees are reportedly targeting elite left-handed power hitter Kyle Tucker to bolster their lineup after a disappointing postseason.  With a potential massive deal, Tucker's blend of power, speed, and discipline makes him an ideal long-term cornerstone, potentially closing the door on Cody Bellinger and ushering in a new offensive era.

title: It’s good, pressure is not only around cricket but also for World Cup final tickets: Harmanpreet
description: The demands and requests for players to arrange tickets for matches have been a constant with the men's team, and Harmanpreet said she and her teammates were now experiencing something similar after pulling off a record chase to oust seven-time champions Australia

title: How is Australia setting standards on training AI? | Explained
description: What did Australia’s Productivity Commission, a government-backed independent agency, propose with respect to training AI systems with copyrighted content? How have authors, artists, trade unions, and media organisations responded to the proposal? What is the Copyright and AI Reference Group?

description: Seelan will next meet Egyptian second seed Lojayn Gohary

title: England loses the 3rd ODI against New Zealand by 2 wickets and the series 3-0
description: New Zealand was desperate at the end, with two wickets remaining and 28 runs still needed to win. But Zak Foulkes with 14 not out and Blair Tickner, with an unbeaten 18, saw New Zealand home with 32 balls to spare and a total of 226-8

title: ‘Blood stains were washed’: Girl dies after falling from 4th floor of school
description: A nine-year-old girl died after falling from the fourth floor of Neerja Modi School in Jaipur under suspicious circumstances. Police have filed a negligence case against the school management and staff, with CCTV footage recovered and FSL teams collecting samples. The school principal stated the girl asked for washroom access before the incident.

title: CEO wisdom: Satya Nadella shares ‘dad tip’ with Sam Altman; reveals his advice for the OpenAI chief
description: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella advised OpenAI's Sam Altman to "just enjoy" fatherhood, reflecting on his own early parenting experience and wishing he could relive it. Altman, who became a father later in life, acknowledged the energy difference but expressed happiness with his journey, despite occasional wishes for his younger self's vigor.

description: Janata Dal (United) candidate Anant Singh was arrested by Patna Police in connection with the murder of Jan Suraaj Party worker Dularchand Yadav. The 75-year-old was shot and run over during a clash between rival groups while campaigning. The arrest follows evidence and eyewitness accounts, with accomplices also taken into custody.

The crime was uncovered after the sister-in-law's family became suspicious.

description: Dodgers pitcher Tyler Glasnow displayed remarkable composure in a critical Game 6. He rescued his team with a three-pitch escape, showcasing his ability to perform under immense pressure. Off the field, his charming courtship with physician assistant Meghan Murphy adds another layer to his story. Glasnow's balance of on-field success and grounded personal life makes him a standout figure.

title: Shane Bieber’s wife reacts to Alejandro Kirk’s wife’s viral World Series post
description: Blue Jays catcher Alejandro Kirk's stellar World Series performance is matched by the heartwarming social media buzz surrounding his wife, Sofia Castaneda. A simple emoji comment from Shane Bieber's wife, Kara, on Sofia's post celebrating Kirk's success ignited a viral moment, highlighting the strong camaraderie among the team's families and captivating fans.

title: Vanessa Bryant recalls Kobe’s heartbreaking moment with daughter Gianna
description: Vanessa Bryant is releasing a photo book, 'Mamba & Mambacita Forever,' featuring cherished memories of Kobe and Gianna Bryant. She shared a touching moment from the 2009 NBA Finals, where Kobe cradled a young Gigi, his focus solely on his daughter's pride. The book aims to preserve these heartfelt moments for the world to remember.

title: China chill: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang says China made it clear; 'they don't want Nvidia there'
description: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang urged the U.S. government to reconsider restrictions on AI chip exports to China, warning that isolating the U.S. from China's vast developer ecosystem could cede AI talent to rivals. Despite China's effective shutdown of Nvidia's operations, the company secured significant deals with the U.S. Department of Energy, underscoring a pivot to fortified U.S. ties.
